intro: Rinorea arborea f. sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Rinorea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and endemic status.
